stripped_doc: Logger object used within the Spoon. Can be accessed to set the default log level for the messages coming from the Spoon.
Variable.doc: Logger object used within the Spoon. Can be accessed to set the default log level for the messages coming from the Spoon.
Variable.name: logger
Variable.desc: Logger object used within the Spoon. Can be accessed to set the default log level for the messages coming from the Spoon.

stripped_doc: Table containing a list of actions to execute for SSID transitions. Each action is itself a table with the following keys:
* to - if given, pattern to match against the new SSID. Defaults to match any network. Transitions through the disabled state are ignored (i.e. normally a `nil` SSID is reported when switching SSIDs)
* from - if given, pattern to match against the previous SSID. Defaults to match any network.
* fn - function or list of functions to execute if there is a match. Each function will receive the following arguments:
* event - always "SSIDChange"
* interface - name of the interface on which the SSID changed
* old_ssid - previous SSID name
* new_ssid - new SSID name
* cmd - shell command to execute if there is a match. If `fn` is given, `cmd` is ignored.
Variable.doc:
Table containing a list of actions to execute for SSID transitions. Each action is itself a table with the following keys:
 * to - if given, pattern to match against the new SSID. Defaults to match any network. Transitions through the disabled state are ignored (i.e. normally a `nil` SSID is reported when switching SSIDs)
 * from - if given, pattern to match against the previous SSID. Defaults to match any network.
 * fn - function or list of functions to execute if there is a match. Each function will receive the following arguments:
   * event - always "SSIDChange"
   * interface - name of the interface on which the SSID changed
   * old_ssid - previous SSID name
   * new_ssid - new SSID name
 * cmd - shell command to execute if there is a match. If `fn` is given, `cmd` is ignored.
Variable.name: actions
Variable.desc: Table containing a list of actions to execute for SSID transitions. Each action is itself a table with the following keys:

desc: Allow arbitrary actions when transitioning between SSIDs

stripped_doc: Process the rules and execute any actions corresponding to the specified transition.
This method is called internally by the `hs.wifi.watcher` object
when WiFi transitions happen. It does not get any system
information nor does it set any Spoon state information, so it can
also be used to "trigger" transitions manually, either for testing
or if the automated processing fails for any reason.
parameters: * prev_ssid - previous SSID name. Defaults to `nil`
* interface - interface where the transition occurred. Defaults to `nil`
Method.doc:
Process the rules and execute any actions corresponding to the specified transition.

This method is called internally by the `hs.wifi.watcher` object
when WiFi transitions happen. It does not get any system
information nor does it set any Spoon state information, so it can
also be used to "trigger" transitions manually, either for testing
or if the automated processing fails for any reason.

Parameters:
 * new_ssid - new SSID name
 * prev_ssid - previous SSID name. Defaults to `nil`
 * interface - interface where the transition occurred. Defaults to `nil`
Method.name: processTransition
Method.desc: Process the rules and execute any actions corresponding to the specified transition.

stripped_doc: Start the WiFi watcher
Method.doc:
Start the WiFi watcher

Returns:
 * The WiFiTransitions spoon object
Method.name: start
